Text: *sigh*

Still unable to cool her excitement, Luna releases a
heavy sigh as she gazes at the exterior of the Hall
of Shadows.

She had finally fulfilled her desire to welcome her
lord into the grand structure.
(I'll treasure this day for the rest of my life...)
I have seen Master Shadow off.

It seems Master Shadow was pleased with his visit.
He seemed quite satisfied when he left...hm?
*sob*
L-Lady Gamma...? What's the matter? You're crying...!

Oh! Perhaps it's because of the pain you experienced
earlier...?! When you faceplanted onto the floor...!

...No. I'd be lying if I said it didn't hurt,
but it's not that.

...I'm sorry you had to see me cry. I'm just so happy
about today...

I see... I hear you created this place with immense
passion. I am sure your happiness is just as great.

That's right. You weren't a part of the Garden yet
when we decided to build this hall.

Huh? Oh, yes. It was already completed by the time I
gained access to Mitsugoshi.

Based on the time frame, did you conceive the idea of
building it when Mitsugoshi was just starting to get
off the ground?
Very impressive. Yes, you're right.
I've been dreaming of this day since then...

A smile forms at the corners of Gamma's lips as she
reminiscences.

A room in Mitsugoshi. Luna has gathered several shop
staff at a large table with a blueprint lying on it.

We'll use high-purity mithril to build all the
columns supporting this atrium.
Mithril?

The pillars alone will cost a significant amount.
What about our other expenses...?
Constructing the Hall of Shadows is our top priority.

Don't worry. We can cover the costs of purchasing the
mithril using next year's sales. As for this wall...

Luna issues a string of instructions while the staff
glances at each other in bewilderment. Then, they
gingerly begin to speak.
Um, excuse me...!
What is it?

Wi-With all due respect, are you certain about this?
Despite Mitsugoshi's current momentum, we are still
a new company...

Based on the blueprint, the building materials are
all of the highest quality... If we continue to use
our budget like this, Mitsugoshi may go under.

Wh-Why not wait a few years? It's never too late to
start once our profits stabilize at a higher margin...!
No!

There can be no compromises to the Hall of Shadows
when we welcome our lord. We must use material of the
highest caliber, no matter the cost!

If our budget is insufficient, we must increase our
profits. That is our duty.
U-Understood!

As the girls begin scurrying about, Luna traces her
fingers across the blueprint.
(This is where our lord will eventually reign...)

(It cannot be a second-rate structure. Everything
must be of the highest quality, majestic, and
beautiful.)

Luna's eyes burn with purpose, intoxicated by the
thought of Master Shadow.

Luna's eyes narrow with nostalgia as she recounts
when she had first set the construction plans in
motion.

Yes... There was even a shortage of the rare metal
mithril in the capital, and we had to use slightly...
aggressive measures to secure what was available.

It resulted in the market value tripling from the
previous year...

I heard it was quite the spectacle. I see... So that
is why mirthril's market value rose so rapidly at
the time.

In fact, the Garden even went to mine mithril because
the amount in circulation wasn't enough.

We did everything from choosing and purchasing the
most promising mines to the actual mining itself. We
couldn't have done it without Zeta's surveying.

I heard rumors it was a challenging period, but I
never knew it was that bad...

Seeing Luna's gleeful recollection of the momentous
events, Nu is slightly taken aback.

And today, we were all rewarded with our lord's
delighted response.
With those words, Luna calmly walks away. However...
*splat!*
She trips and falls on the floor's flat surface.
L-Lady Gamma?!

Though blood flows from Luna's nostrils, she couldn't
have looked more satisfied.
